page.title: 03Leighfield Housing Patterns
page.content: Of the seven lodges and farms shown in the block only three are still occupied. Leigh Lodge Farm (829040) is occupied by a tenant farmer. It is subject to a Restrictive Preservation Order and therefore can't be allowed to fall down should it become vacant. This farm is one of the most accessible by road which accounts for it's continued habitation. In winter the area is exposed due to lack of hedgerows and is susceptible to drifting snow. The road to the farm is metalled and straight and joins a public road 2 Km away. The other lodges owe their demise to their inaccessibility, especially in winter. Swintley Lodge (825045) was occupied until 15 years ago. It had access only by bridlepath. Those employed on the land tend to live outside the area.
